## Git.(constructor)

Handles invoking the git-\*-pack binaries

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
constructor(repoDir: string | ((dir?: string) => string), options?: GitOptions);
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  repoDir | string | ((dir?: string) => string) | Create a new repository collection from the directory <code>repoDir</code>. <code>repoDir</code> should be entirely empty except for git repo directories. If <code>repoDir</code> is a function, <code>repoDir(repo)</code> will be used to dynamically resolve project directories. The return value of <code>repoDir(repo)</code> should be a string path specifying where to put the string <code>repo</code>. Make sure to return the same value for <code>repo</code> every time since <code>repoDir(repo)</code> will be called multiple times. |
|  options | [GitOptions](./node-git-server.gitoptions.md) | options that can be applied on the new instance being created |
